{"step_by_step_thinking": "Anticoagulant preservatives are used to store blood for transfusion purposes. Acid citrate dextrose (ACD) can store blood for up to 21 days. CPD Citrate phosphate dextrose can store blood for up to 21 days as well. CP2D - citrate phosphate double dextrose can store blood for up to 35 days. However, Citrate phosphate dextrose-adenine (CPD-A) can store blood for up to 35 days and it also helps to maintain the viability of the red cells.", "answer_choice": "C. Citrate phosphate dextrose-adenine (CPD-A)"}
